etymology.description: 点 (to dot; to point) + 茶 (tea) = traditional tea whisking method
etymology.interpretation: 点茶 refers to an ancient method of preparing and serving tea by whisking powdered tea to produce a frothy mixture. It is a classical technique that is characteristic of traditional Chinese tea culture.

examples.chinese: 点茶是一种古老而优雅的茶艺。
examples.pinyin: Diǎn chá shì yī zhǒng gǔlǎo ér yōuyǎ de chá yì.
examples.english: The 点茶 method is an ancient and elegant tea art form.

examples.chinese: 在唐朝时, 点茶是一种流行的茶艺。
examples.pinyin: Zài Táng cháo shí, diǎn chá shì yī zhǒng liúxíng de chá yì.
examples.english: During the Tang dynasty, 点茶 was a popular tea art technique.
